SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
Decmbmr 4, 1961
Bill Harley
NAEB
Washington, D. C.
Dear Bill:
I notice in a recent report from American Council
on Education that the Executive Committee voted
to'organize a project to study the problems of
copyrights, royalties, compensation and teacher
rights in the production, performance and distribut¬
ion# of educational radio and television programs,
educational films and programs for teaching machines.'
I hope the broadcast interests will be ad^uately
represented in the project they undertake. Is there
anything we can or should be doing in this. If you
find things you would like the Television Board
to do, please let me know.
Loren B. Stone, Ch.
TV Board.
RECEIVED
naeb headquarters
